description: This course explores the childbearing process in healthy and high-risk families.  Clinical
experiences are provided with families during pregnancy, labor and delivery, and following birth.
Clinical settings include hospital birth centers, clinics, and home care agencies.  Students
develop the role of educator by working with parents to integrate and care for a new member of
the family system.  Prerequisite: Nursing 336. Offered annually in the fall semester. Counts
toward women's studies major and concentration.
